citeinfo.origin: Naval Weather Service Environmental Detachment, Asheville, North Carolina
citeinfo.title: Monthly Mean Maritime Surface Weather, Physical Oceanography, and Seasonal Mean Extratropical Storms for the Northeast Pacific Ocean

abstract.p: Publication Title: Northeast Pacific Environmental Scenario.

Contains monthly mean low cloud with visibility/wind speed; total cloud by wind direction; relative wet bulb humidity; fog and visibility by wind direction; precipitation types by wind direction; sea surface temperature by wind direction with wind speed; sea wave direction/period with recurrence intervals; wind direction and speed; daylight / darkness graphs and seasonal mean extratropical storms and currents. Observations used to compute this climatology span a period of more than 100 years. Most data were collected during the post World War II period until about 1974.
Includes information from Ocean Weather Stations P and N.
Available from the NOAA Library System: URL http://www.lib.noaa.gov/.

descript.purpose: This publication is in the National Oceanic & Atmospheric Administration Library, and is one of many books, atlases, maps, charts and other printed materials received by NOAA from many nations over the years.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
